animals.name: African Elephant
animals.habitat: African savannas and forests
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily eats grasses, fruits, and bark
animals.description: The largest land animal, characterized by its long trunk, large ears, and tusks.

animals.name: Great White Shark
animals.habitat: Coastal waters of major oceans
animals.diet: Carnivore - feeds on seals, fish, and other marine animals
animals.description: One of the most feared predators of the ocean, known for its powerful jaws and streamlined body.

animals.name: Peregrine Falcon
animals.habitat: Wide-ranging habitats from tundras to cities
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily preys on birds in mid-flight
animals.description: The fastest bird in the world, known for its high-speed dives when hunting.

animals.name: Giant Panda
animals.habitat: Mountain ranges of central China
animals.diet: Herbivore - mainly consumes bamboo
animals.description: Symbol of wildlife conservation, characterized by its black-and-white fur pattern and bamboo diet.

animals.name: Blue Whale
animals.habitat: Oceans worldwide
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily consumes krill
animals.description: The largest animal ever known to have existed, distinguished by its immense size and deep blue coloration.

animals.name: Komodo Dragon
animals.habitat: Islands of Indonesia
animals.diet: Carnivore - hunts various animals including deer, birds, and water buffalo
animals.description: The world's largest lizard, known for its powerful bite and venomous saliva.

animals.name: Snow Leopard
animals.habitat: Mountain ranges of Central and South Asia
animals.diet: Carnivore - preys on Himalayan blue sheep, ibex, and other small mammals
animals.description: Elusive and endangered big cat adapted to cold, rugged mountain environments.

animals.name: Red Kangaroo
animals.habitat: Grasslands and deserts of Australia
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily grazes on grasses
animals.description: The largest kangaroo species, known for its powerful hind legs and distinctive hopping movement.

animals.name: Emperor Penguin
animals.habitat: Antarctic ice and surrounding waters
animals.diet: Carnivore - feeds on fish, krill, and squid
animals.description: The largest penguin species, notable for its endurance in the harsh Antarctic environment.

animals.name: Giraffe
animals.habitat: Savannas of Africa
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily eats leaves and buds from trees
animals.description: Tallest living terrestrial animal, recognized by its long neck, patterned coat, and distinctively shaped horns.

animals.name: Bengal Tiger
animals.habitat: Forests of India, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Bhutan
animals.diet: Carnivore - hunts various prey including deer and wild boar
animals.description: One of the largest tiger subspecies, known for its striking orange coat with dark stripes.

animals.name: Orangutan
animals.habitat: Rainforests of Borneo and Sumatra
animals.diet: Primarily frugivore - consumes fruits, leaves, and insects
animals.description: Great ape species characterized by its reddish-brown fur and highly intelligent nature.

animals.name: Humpback Whale
animals.habitat: Oceans worldwide, migrating between feeding and breeding grounds
animals.diet: Carnivore - feeds on krill, small fish, and plankton
animals.description: Large marine mammal known for its acrobatic behavior, especially during breaching.

animals.name: Cheetah
animals.habitat: Grasslands and open plains of Africa
animals.diet: Carnivore - fastest land animal, primarily hunts small to medium-sized ungulates
animals.description: Sleek and slender big cat, recognized for its incredible speed and spotted coat.

animals.name: Polar Bear
animals.habitat: Arctic sea ice, coastlines, and islands
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily feeds on seals
animals.description: Largest land carnivore, adapted to cold environments with its thick fur and layer of blubber.

animals.name: Anaconda
animals.habitat: Tropical rainforests and swamps of South America
animals.diet: Carnivore - ambush predator that primarily hunts aquatic prey
animals.description: One of the largest snakes in the world, known for its impressive size and constricting abilities.

animals.name: Manta Ray
animals.habitat: Tropical and subtropical waters worldwide
animals.diet: Filter feeder - consumes plankton and small fish
animals.description: Giant ray species known for its large size, graceful movements, and distinctive cephalic fins.

animals.name: Koala
animals.habitat: Eucalyptus forests of eastern Australia
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily eats eucalyptus leaves
animals.description: Marsupial species known for its tree-dwelling habits, pouch for young, and distinct nose.

animals.name: African Lion
animals.habitat: Savannas and grasslands of sub-Saharan Africa
animals.diet: Carnivore - apex predator, hunts a variety of prey including antelopes and zebras
animals.description: Large carnivorous feline, symbolizing strength and majesty in African ecosystems.

animals.name: Red Fox
animals.habitat: Various habitats including forests, grasslands, and urban areas
animals.diet: Omnivore - opportunistic feeder consuming small mammals, birds, fruits, and insects
animals.description: Adaptable and widespread fox species, known for its cunning behavior and distinctive red coat.

animals.name: Gorilla
animals.habitat: Forests of Central Africa
animals.diet: Primarily herbivore - consumes leaves, fruits, and stems
animals.description: Largest living primate, characterized by its powerful build and calm demeanor.

animals.name: Galápagos Giant Tortoise
animals.habitat: Galápagos Islands, Ecuador
animals.diet: Herbivore - grazes on grasses, cacti, and fruits
animals.description: Long-lived and iconic tortoise species, symbolizing the unique biodiversity of the Galápagos Islands.

animals.name: Snowy Owl
animals.habitat: Arctic regions of North America and Eurasia
animals.diet: Carnivore - preys on lemmings, rodents, and birds
animals.description: Large owl species known for its striking white plumage, adaptation to cold climates, and piercing yellow eyes.

animals.name: Red Panda
animals.habitat: Himalayan foothills of Nepal, India, and China
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily consumes bamboo leaves and shoots
animals.description: Small arboreal mammal, known for its reddish-brown fur, bushy tail, and bamboo diet.

animals.name: Manatee
animals.habitat: Shallow, slow-moving rivers, estuaries, and coastal waters
animals.diet: Herbivore - feeds on aquatic plants
animals.description: Large aquatic mammal, often referred to as 'sea cows', known for their gentle nature and herbivorous diet.

animals.name: Komodo Dragon
animals.habitat: Islands of Komodo, Rinca, Flores, and Gili Motang in Indonesia
animals.diet: Carnivore - hunts various prey including deer, pigs, and birds
animals.description: Largest living species of lizard, known for its formidable size, sharp teeth, and venomous bite.

animals.name: Siberian Tiger
animals.habitat: Forests of eastern Russia
animals.diet: Carnivore - hunts large ungulates like deer and wild boar
animals.description: Subspecies of tiger adapted to cold climates, characterized by its thick fur and powerful build.

animals.name: Wallaby
animals.habitat: Various habitats including forests, grasslands, and deserts of Australia and nearby islands
animals.diet: Herbivore - grazes on grasses and plants
animals.description: Marsupial similar to kangaroos but smaller in size, known for its hopping locomotion and pouch for young.

animals.name: Arctic Fox
animals.habitat: Arctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere
animals.diet: Omnivore - consumes small mammals, birds, eggs, and berries
animals.description: Adapted to cold environments with its thick fur coat, known for its seasonal color change from white to gray/brown.

animals.name: Ocelot
animals.habitat: Forests, grasslands, and scrublands of South America, Central America, and Mexico
animals.diet: Carnivore - preys on small mammals, birds, and reptiles
animals.description: Wild cat species with a beautiful spotted coat, recognized for its agility and nocturnal hunting behavior.

animals.name: African Wild Dog
animals.habitat: Sub-Saharan Africa
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily hunts antelopes and other small mammals
animals.description: Highly social canid species, known for its distinctive coat patterns and cooperative hunting behavior.

animals.name: Toucan
animals.habitat: Rainforests of Central and South America
animals.diet: Frugivore - consumes fruits, insects, and small reptiles
animals.description: Colorful bird species with a large, distinctive beak, known for its vibrant plumage and fruit-eating habits.

animals.name: Pangolin
animals.habitat: Tropical regions of Africa and Asia
animals.diet: Insectivore - feeds mainly on ants and termites
animals.description: Unique mammal species covered in scales, known for its protective curling behavior and endangered status.

animals.name: Galápagos Marine Iguana
animals.habitat: Galápagos Islands, Ecuador
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily eats algae and seaweed
animals.description: Only marine iguana species in the world, adapted to foraging underwater and sunbathing on rocks.

animals.name: Platypus
animals.habitat: Eastern Australia, including freshwater rivers and streams
animals.diet: Carnivore - feeds on aquatic invertebrates
animals.description: Egg-laying mammal with a duck-bill, beaver-like tail, and venomous spurs, representing a fascinating evolutionary anomaly.

animals.name: Mandrill
animals.habitat: Rainforests of central Africa
animals.diet: Omnivore - consumes fruits, seeds, insects, and small vertebrates
animals.description: Colorful primate species, recognized for its striking facial colors, social structure, and prominent canines.

animals.name: Hyacinth Macaw
animals.habitat: Pantanal region of South America
animals.diet: Herbivore - feeds on nuts, fruits, and seeds
animals.description: Largest macaw species, known for its vibrant blue feathers, powerful beak, and endangered status.

animals.name: Giant Anteater
animals.habitat: Grasslands, savannas, and forests of Central and South America
animals.diet: Insectivore - primarily eats ants and termites
animals.description: Large anteater species with a long snout and tongue, adapted for specialized insect-eating behavior.

animals.name: Leafcutter Ant
animals.habitat: Tropical forests of Central and South America
animals.diet: Herbivore - cultivates fungus on leaf fragments
animals.description: Highly organized ant species known for its impressive leaf-cutting and fungus-farming behaviors.

animals.name: Fennec Fox
animals.habitat: Desert regions of North Africa
animals.diet: Omnivore - consumes insects, small mammals, and plants
animals.description: Small fox species with large ears, adapted for heat regulation in desert environments.

animals.name: Axolotl
animals.habitat: Xochimilco lake complex in Mexico
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily consumes worms, insects, and small fish
animals.description: Unique salamander species known for its regenerative abilities, external gills, and neotenic features.

animals.name: Narwhal
animals.habitat: Arctic waters near Canada, Greenland, and Russia
animals.diet: Carnivore - feeds on fish, squid, and shrimp
animals.description: Whale species recognized for its long, spiral tusk, which is actually an elongated tooth.

animals.name: Sloth
animals.habitat: Rainforests of Central and South America
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily consumes leaves, shoots, and fruits
animals.description: Slow-moving mammal known for its relaxed pace, arboreal habitat, and unique metabolic adaptations.

animals.name: Cassowary
animals.habitat: Tropical forests of New Guinea and northern Australia
animals.diet: Omnivore - feeds on fruits, insects, small animals, and even carrion
animals.description: Large, flightless bird species with a distinct casque atop its head, known for its powerful legs and potential danger.

animals.name: Tarsier
animals.habitat: Islands of Southeast Asia
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily eats insects
animals.description: Small primate species with enormous eyes, known for its unique locomotion, and excellent nocturnal vision.

animals.name: Dhole
animals.habitat: Forests and grasslands of Asia
animals.diet: Carnivore - hunts in packs, preying on deer, wild boar, and other mammals
animals.description: Wild dog species, recognized for its social behavior, distinctive vocalizations, and cooperative hunting strategies.

animals.name: Okapi
animals.habitat: Ituri rainforest of the Democratic Republic of Congo
animals.diet: Herbivore - feeds on leaves, grasses, and fruits
animals.description: Giraffe-relative species known for its striped legs, velvet-like fur, and secretive nature.

animals.name: Proboscis Monkey
animals.habitat: Mangrove forests and riverine areas of Borneo
animals.diet: Primarily herbivore - consumes leaves, fruits, and seeds
animals.description: Monkey species with a distinctive large nose, known for its unique appearance, social structure, and jumping ability.

animals.name: Quokka
animals.habitat: Rottnest Island and nearby mainland in Western Australia
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily feeds on grasses, leaves, and succulent plants
animals.description: Marsupial species known for its friendly appearance, smiling facial expression, and affinity for human interaction.

animals.name: Capybara
animals.habitat: Wetlands, grasslands, and forests of South America
animals.diet: Herbivore - grazes on grasses and aquatic plants
animals.description: Largest living rodent species, recognized for its semi-aquatic lifestyle, social behavior, and grazing habits.

animals.name: Pika
animals.habitat: Rocky mountainous regions of Asia, North America, and parts of Europe
animals.diet: Herbivore - mainly eats grasses, herbs, and other alpine plants
animals.description: Small mammal related to rabbits and hares, known for its distinctive calls, burrowing behavior, and adaptation to cold climates.

animals.name: Peacock
animals.habitat: Forests and grasslands of India and Sri Lanka
animals.diet: Omnivore - feeds on insects, plants, and small creatures
animals.description: Colorful bird species with elaborate tail feathers, recognized for its vibrant plumage, courtship displays, and symbolic significance.

animals.name: Elephant Seal
animals.habitat: Subantarctic and Antarctic regions
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily feeds on fish, squid, and crustaceans
animals.description: Large marine mammal species known for its immense size, impressive diving abilities, and distinctively protruding proboscis.

animals.name: Moose
animals.habitat: Forests of North America, Europe, and Asia
animals.diet: Herbivore - consumes aquatic plants, shrubs, and trees
animals.description: Largest extant species in the deer family, recognized for its imposing antlers, herbivorous diet, and preference for cold climates.

animals.name: Cockatoo
animals.habitat: Rainforests, woodlands, and grasslands of Australia and nearby regions
animals.diet: Omnivore - feeds on seeds, fruits, insects, and small creatures
animals.description: Bird species with a distinct crest, known for its loud vocalizations, social behavior, and varied plumage.

animals.name: Sable Antelope
animals.habitat: Grasslands and savannas of eastern and southern Africa
animals.diet: Herbivore - primarily grazes on grasses and leaves
animals.description: Large antelope species with impressive curved horns, recognized for its agility, social structure, and adaptation to open habitats.

animals.name: Red Panda
animals.habitat: Himalayan forests of Nepal, India, and China
animals.diet: Primarily herbivore - feeds on bamboo leaves, fruits, and insects
animals.description: Tree-dwelling mammal with a raccoon-like appearance, known for its bushy tail, arboreal habits, and endangered status.

animals.name: Snow Leopard
animals.habitat: Mountain ranges of Central and South Asia
animals.diet: Carnivore - preys on blue sheep, ibex, and other mountainous species
animals.description: Elusive big cat species adapted to cold, rugged terrain, known for its beautiful fur pattern and stealthy hunting abilities.

animals.name: Jaguarundi
animals.habitat: Forests, shrublands, and grasslands of Central and South America
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily feeds on small mammals, birds, and reptiles
animals.description: Wild cat species with a unique appearance, known for its slender build, short legs, and adaptable nature.

animals.name: Gharial
animals.habitat: Rivers of the northern Indian subcontinent
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily eats fish
animals.description: Critically endangered crocodilian species known for its long, narrow snout, adapted for catching fish, and distinctively elongated jaw.

animals.name: Binturong
animals.habitat: Forests of Southeast Asia
animals.diet: Omnivore - consumes fruits, insects, and small vertebrates
animals.description: Mammal with a bear-cat appearance, known for its prehensile tail, nocturnal habits, and distinct scent reminiscent of popcorn.

animals.name: Sun Bear
animals.habitat: Tropical forests of Southeast Asia
animals.diet: Omnivore - primarily feeds on fruits, insects, and honey
animals.description: Smallest bear species, recognized for its sleek fur, golden crescent chest mark, and arboreal foraging habits.

animals.name: Wolverine
animals.habitat: Northern forests and tundra regions of North America, Europe, and Asia
animals.diet: Omnivore - scavenges and hunts small mammals, birds, and carrion
animals.description: Strongest member of the weasel family, known for its robust build, endurance, and tenacious nature.

animals.name: Golden Eagle
animals.habitat: Mountainous regions, open landscapes, and tundras of the Northern Hemisphere
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily hunts small to medium-sized mammals and birds
animals.description: Powerful bird of prey, recognized for its majestic appearance, agility in flight, and keen eyesight.

animals.name: Fossa
animals.habitat: Forests of Madagascar
animals.diet: Carnivore - preys on lemurs, birds, and other small animals
animals.description: Carnivore related to the mongoose family, known for its elongated body, semi-retractable claws, and arboreal hunting skills.

animals.name: Aye-Aye
animals.habitat: Rainforests of Madagascar
animals.diet: Omnivore - primarily feeds on grubs, insects, and fruits
animals.description: Nocturnal primate species with a unique appearance, featuring a long middle finger used for tapping and extracting insect larvae.

animals.name: Black Mamba
animals.habitat: Savannas and rocky areas of sub-Saharan Africa
animals.diet: Carnivore - preys on small mammals, birds, and occasionally other snakes
animals.description: Highly venomous snake species, recognized for its agility, speed, and potentially deadly neurotoxic venom.

animals.name: Numbat
animals.habitat: Woodlands of Western Australia
animals.diet: Insectivore - primarily consumes termites
animals.description: Marsupial species with a slender body, banded fur pattern, and specialized long tongue for extracting termites from logs and soil.

animals.name: Frigatebird
animals.habitat: Tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide
animals.diet: Carnivore - primarily feeds on fish and squid
animals.description: Seabird species known for its striking appearance, impressive wingspan, and ability to stay airborne for extended periods.

animals.name: Pangolin
animals.habitat: Various habitats in Africa and Asia
animals.diet: Insectivore - feeds on ants and termites
animals.description: Unique mammal covered in protective scales, known for its specialized diet, nocturnal habits, and endangered status due to illegal wildlife trade.
